intro: Hernandia ovigera var. mascarenensis, commonly known as the Mascarene hernandia, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and distinctive inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, simple, and have a leathery texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. This species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
